title: Nepal President’s aide resigns after criticising inclusion of Indian territories on currency note - The Federal
description: Nepal President’s aide resigns after criticising inclusion of Indian territories on currency note  The Federal
publisher.title: The Federal
full_article:
The economic advisor to Nepal's President Ram Chandra Paudel has resigned after a controversy broke out over his remarks on the government’s decision to issue new hundred-rupee notes with a map that includes three Indian territories, a move already rejected by India.

A press release issued by the Office of the President said Paudel approved Chiranjivi Nepal's resignation on Sunday.

'Inappropriate move’

Chiranjivi, a former governor of the country’s central bank, had reportedly termed the government’s decision to print the new map on the notes as ‘an inappropriate move’.

A cabinet meeting last week decided to replace the old map with the new one while printing new notes of ₹100.

The new map includes territories such as Kalapani, Lipulekh and Limpiyadhura.

India maintains Lipulekh, Kalapani and Limpiyadhura belong to it.

CPN-UML chairman and former Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli had publicly criticised Chiranjivi for his remarks.

"I have raised this serious issue to draw the public attention as it might cause practical problems to the people," Chiranjivi said in his resignation letter, an aide to the president told PTI on condition of anonymity.

“I have tendered my resignation from the post to maintain the dignity of the honourable president, as attempts were made to unnecessarily drag the president into controversy citing my statement,” Chiranjivi pointed out.

Chiranjivi went against national interest: Civil society

Earlier, a group of civil society leaders had demanded the removal of Chiranjivi over his remarks against the government's decision to print new hundred-rupee notes with the map of Nepal as per the amended Constitution.

They argued that he had gone against national interest and breached decorum while speaking to the national and international media on the matter.

Nepal's government unveiled its new political map with the inclusion of Lipulek, Kalapani and Limpiyadhura areas within its territory in May 2020 during the government led by Oli. It was later endorsed by the Parliament unanimously. After that, the government has replaced the old map used in all the official documents with the new map despite India’s objection.

“This artificial enlargement of claims is not based on historical fact or evidence and is not tenable. It is also violative of our current understanding to hold talks on outstanding boundary issues," India's External Affairs Ministry said at that time.

Last week, Indian External Affairs Minister S Jayashankar expressed discontent over the Nepal government's decision to issue the new notes.

Jaishankar said that it is not going to change the situation on the ground.

Nepal shares a border of over 1,850 km with five Indian states – Sikkim, West Bengal, Bihar, Uttar Pradesh and Uttarakhand.

(With inputs from agencies)
translated: नेपाल केरऽ राष्ट्रपति राम चंद्र पौदेल केरऽ आर्थिक सलाहकार न॑ सरकार केरऽ नयका सौ-रुपनी नोट जारी करै के फैसला प॑ अपनऽ टिप्पणी प॑ विवाद के बाद एक नक्शा के साथ एगो विवाद के बाद इस्तीफा द॑ देल॑ छै जेकरा म॑ तीन भारतीय क्षेत्र शामिल छै, जेकरा भारत न॑ पहल॑ स॑ ही खारिज करी देल॑ छै ।राष्ट्रपति के कार्यालय द्वारा जारी प्रेस विज्ञप्ति में कहल गेल अछि जे पौदेल रविदिन चिरनजीवी नेपाल के इस्तीफा के मंजूरी द रहल अछि।देश केरऽ केंद्रीय बैंक केरऽ पूर्व गवर्नर चिरंजीवी ‘अनुकूल चाल’ न॑ नोटऽ प॑ नयका नक्शा क॑ ‘अनुचित कदम’ के रूप म॑ प्रिंट करै के सरकार केरऽ फैसला क॑ कहलऽ गेलऽ छेलै ।पिछला सप्ताह एकटा कैबिनेट मीटिंग मे पुरान नक्शा के बदलय के फैसला भेल छल जखन कि ₹100 के नवका नोट छपय के.नव नक्शा मे कलापानी, लिप्यूलेख आ लिम्पियाधुरा सन इलाका शामिल अछि।भारत लिप्युलेख, कलापानी आ लिम्पियादहुरा के बरकरार रखने अछि।सीपीएन-यूएमएल के अध्यक्ष आरू पूर्व प्रधानमंत्री केपी शर्मा ओली न॑ अपनऽ टिप्पणी लेली चिरनजीवी के सार्वजनिक आलोचना करल॑ छेलै ।राष्ट्रपति केरऽ एगो सहायक न॑ गुमनामी के हालत के बारे म॑ पीटीआई क॑ कहलकै कि हम्में ई गंभीर मुद्दा क॑ जनता के ध्यान आकर्षित करै लेली उठैल॑ छियै, कैन्हेंकि ई लोगऽ क॑ व्यावहारिक समस्या पैदा होय सकै छै ।चिरनजीवी न॑ इशारा करलकै, “हम॑ अपनऽ इस्तीफा क॑ सम्मानित राष्ट्रपति केरऽ गरिमा क॑ बरकरार रखै लेली पद स॑ टेंडर करी देल॑ छै, कैन्हेंकि राष्ट्रपति क॑ हमरऽ बयान के हवाला दैत॑ विवाद म॑ अनावश्यक रूप स॑ घसीटै के कोशिश करलऽ गेलऽ छेलै ।चिरंजीवी राष्ट्रीय हित के खिलाफ गेलऽ छेलै: नागरिक समाज स॑ पहल॑ नागरिक समाज केरऽ नेता सिनी के एगो समूह न॑ संशोधित संविधान के अनुसार नेपाल केरऽ नक्शा के साथ नयका सौ-रुपनी नोट्स प्रिंट करै के सरकार केरऽ फैसला के खिलाफ चिरंजीवी क॑ हटाबै के मांग करल॑ छेलै ।हुनकऽ तर्क छेलै कि हुनी राष्ट्रीय हित के खिलाफ गेलऽ छेलै आरू ई मामला प॑ राष्ट्रीय आरू अंतर्राष्ट्रीय मीडिया स॑ बात करतें हुअ॑ डेकोरम के उल्लंघन करलकै ।नेपाल केरऽ सरकार न॑ मई २०२० म॑ ओली के नेतृत्व म॑ सरकार के दौरान अपनऽ क्षेत्र के भीतर लिप्युलेक, कलापानी आरू लिम्पियाधुरा क्षेत्रऽ क॑ शामिल करी क॑ अपनऽ नया राजनीतिक नक्शा के अनावरण करलकै ।बाद मे एकर समर्थन सर्वसम्मति स केलक।एकरऽ बाद सरकार न॑ भारत केरऽ आपत्ति के बावजूद सब आधिकारिक दस्तावेजऽ म॑ इस्तेमाल करलऽ गेलऽ पुरानऽ नक्शा के जगह प॑ नया नक्शा स॑ बदली देल॑ छै ।“ई दावा केरऽ ई कृत्रिम विस्तार ऐतिहासिक तथ्य या सबूतऽ प॑ आधारित नै छै आरू ई टेनेबल नै छै ।बकाया सीमा मुद्दा पर वार्ता आयोजित करब हमरा सभक वर्तमान समझदारीक उल्लंघन सेहो अछि।' कि नेपाल केरऽ स्थिति म॑ बदलाव नै आबै वाला छै, जेकरा म॑ पाँच भारतीय राज्य – सिक्किम, पश्चिम बंगाल, बिहार, उत्तर प्रदेश आरू उत्तराखंड के साथ १,८५० किमी स॑ भी अधिक के सीमा साझा करलऽ जाय छै ।
label: Interview

title: Indian territories on Nepali notes: President's economic advisor quits, criticising inclusion - Deccan Herald

It was later endorsed by the Parliament unanimously. After that, the government has replaced the old map used in all the official documents with the new map despite India’s objection.
translated: नेपाल केरऽ सरकार न॑ मई २०२० म॑ ओली के नेतृत्व म॑ सरकार के दौरान अपनऽ क्षेत्र के भीतर लिप्युलेक, कलापानी आरू लिम्पियाधुरा क्षेत्रऽ क॑ शामिल करी क॑ अपनऽ नया राजनीतिक नक्शा के अनावरण करलकै ।बाद मे एकर समर्थन सर्वसम्मति स केलक।एकरऽ बाद सरकार न॑ भारत केरऽ आपत्ति के बावजूद सब आधिकारिक दस्तावेजऽ म॑ इस्तेमाल करलऽ गेलऽ पुरानऽ नक्शा के जगह प॑ नया नक्शा स॑ बदली देल॑ छै ।

title: Nepal President's Aide Resigns After Criticising Notes With Map Of Indian Region - NDTV
description: Nepal President's Aide Resigns After Criticising Notes With Map Of Indian Region  NDTV
publisher.title: NDTV
full_article:
A Cabinet meeting last week decided to replace the old map with the new one. (File)

The economic advisor to Nepal's President Ram Chandra Paudel has resigned after his controversial remarks on the government's decision to issue new hundred-rupee notes with a map that includes three Indian territories, a move already rejected by India.

The President approved Chiranjivi Nepal's resignation on Sunday, according to the press release issued by the Office of the President.

Ex-governor of the country's central bank, Chiranjivi Nepal had reportedly termed the government's decision to print the new map on the notes as ‘an inappropriate move'.

window._rrCode = window._rrCode || [];_rrCode.push(function(){ (function(v,d,o,ai){ai=d.createElement("script");ai.defer=true;ai.async=true;ai.src=v.location.protocol+o;d.head.appendChild(ai);})(window, document, "//a.vdo.ai/core/v-ndtv/vdo.ai.js"); });

A Cabinet meeting last week decided to replace the old map with the new one while printing new notes of Rs 100.

The new map includes territories such as Kalapani, Lipulekh and Limpiyadhura.

India maintains Lipulekh, Kalapani and Limpiyadhura belong to it.

CPN-UML chairman and former Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli had publicly criticised Chiranjivi Nepal for his remarks.

"I have raised this serious issue to draw the public attention as it might cause practical problems to the people," Chiranjivi Nepal mentioned in his resignation letter, an aide to the president told PTI on condition of anonymity.

“I have tendered my resignation from the post to maintain the dignity of the honourable President, as attempts were made to unnecessarily drag the president into controversy citing my statement,” Chiranjivi Nepal pointed out.

Earlier, a group of civil society leaders had demanded the removal of Chiranjivi Nepal over his remarks against the government's decision to print new hundred-rupee notes with the map of Nepal as per the amended Constitution.

They argued that he had gone against national interest and breached decorum while speaking to the national and international media on the matter.

Nepal's government unveiled its new political map with the inclusion of Lipulek, Kalapani and Limpiyadhura areas within its territory in May 2020 during the government led by Oli. It was later endorsed by the Parliament unanimously. After that, the government has replaced the old map used in all the official documents with the new map despite India's objection.

“This artificial enlargement of claims is not based on historical fact or evidence and is not tenable. It is also violative of our current understanding to hold talks on outstanding boundary issues," India's External Affairs Ministry said at that time.

Indian External Affairs Minister S Jayashankar last week expressed discontent over the Nepal government's decision to issue the new notes.

Jaishankar said that it is not going to change the situation on the ground.

title: Nepal’s flimsy claims on Kali River will not change ground realities, but India must be vigilant - Indian Defence Review
description: Nepal’s flimsy claims on Kali River will not change ground realities, but India must be vigilant  Indian Defence Review
publisher.title: Indian Defence Review
full_article:
First Pillar on Sino-Nepal border near Tinkar Pass

Nepal’s flimsy claims on Kali River will not change ground realities, but India must be vigilant

Kathmandu seems to have forgotten that the location of the Kali river on the maps of the Sino-Nepali treaty matches with the Indian stand: Kalapani is on Indian territory. Image: Wikimedia Commons

A recent visit to the border areas of the Central Sector of the Indo-Tibet boundary was an eye-opener. The first thing that I witnessed was the considerable efforts that have been made by the Central government (through the Border Road Organisation of the Indian Army) to connect to ‘the world’ in these remote locations.

The accounts of travellers, yogis (particularly Swami Pranavanada in the 1930s), yatris (to Kailash Mountain), or Indian officials posted in Gartok in western Tibet always struck me for the description of the harsh terrain near the tri-junction of India, Tibet, and Nepal; till recently, the journey was indeed extremely perilous.

To give an example, a few years ago, it took up to a 27-day walk for a yatri to travel from Darchula to Lipulekh and later come back (in Tibet, they were taken by buses to the Kailash base camp). Today the road reaches a few hundred metres from the top of Lipulekh, the border pass separating Kumaon (near the trijunction with Tibet and Nepal) from Purang County (Dzong) in Tibet.

The black-topping of the road between Darchula and Lipulekh is not yet fully completed, but it is a matter of a few more months before the tar will be laid all the way to the pass.

The implication of this development is that access to the Indian Army and the Indo-Tibet Border Police (ITBP) is far easier; today, the defence forces can answer any contingencies in the shortest possible time, which also makes the lives of the local population simpler.

Though this area did not witness any confrontation during the 1962 War with China and is not directly claimed by Beijing, it remains ‘disputed’ through China’s proxy, Nepal.

In the News Again

The issue was recently in the news when Kathmandu decided to incorporate on their 100-rupee banknotes a new political map of Nepal, covering the so-called disputed territories of Lipulekh, Limpiyadhura, and Kalapani as part of the Nepali territory.

External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar was quick to answer: “I saw that report. I have not looked at it in detail, but I think our position is very clear. With Nepal, we were having discussions about our boundary matters through an established platform. And then, in the middle of that, they unilaterally took some measures on their side. But by doing something on their side, [Nepal is] not going to change the situation between us or the reality on the ground,” said Jaishankar.

Nepal, which now tries to unilaterally change the maps, has not always claimed the Indian village of Kalapani, the main resurgence of the Kali river, which has its origin in a rivulet near Lipulekh.

In May 2020, an argument erupted between India and Nepal; the immediate reason was an 80-km road from Darchula to Lipulekh.

Strategically, this road is crucial for India, but also important for the yatris and local traders, Lipulekh being one of the three landports between India and Tibet.

It was only in 1998 that the CPN-ML faction led by Bam Dev Gautam started claiming some Indian territory in the vicinity of Kalapani as Nepalese. According to Buddhi Narayan Shrestha, a former Director General of the Land Survey Department, the ‘Kali River’ was the Kuti Yankti river that arises below the Limpiyadhura range and not the Kali accepted by India; Nepal began then claiming an entire area of 400 km².

But why was no claim put forward by Nepal for the previous 150 years?

This has never been explained by Kathmandu, and some flimsy historical excuses are being used today.

A Nepali argument is that the flow of the Kuti river is more significant, though this does not prove anything. In his book, History of the Kailash-Mansarovar, Swami Pranavananda, who extensively wrote on the subject, mentioned the confluence of the Kali and Kuti rivers “at a distance of 2 or 3 furlongs down below the road. Though the River Kuti is almost twice or thrice as big as Kali, the Kali is taken to be the main river.” The Swami also noted that the local population attached to Garbyang village is not of Nepali stock.

Tracing the History

After a war between British India and Nepal in 1814, the Nepalis were sent back across the Kali River in May 1815, and subsequently, the Sugauli Treaty was signed on March 4, 1816. Article 5 of the Treaty stated: “The Rajah of Nepaul renounces for himself, his heirs and successors, all claim to or connexion with the countries lying to the west of the River Kali, and engages never to have any concern with those countries or the inhabitants thereof.”

Unfortunately, no map was attached, which could have authoritatively shown the exact alignment and source of the Kali River.

In any case, at that time, no scientific survey worth the name could be carried out; it was only by the mid-19th century that the Himalayan border was first surveyed by the Great Trigonometrical Survey of India (a precursor of the Survey of India), in a more scientific manner.

Today, the Nepalis base their claims on an old map that is neither accurate nor authentic. From 1998 until 2020, the Nepalese government continued to keep quiet, but in May 2020, Kathmandu for the first time released a map incorporating the entire area east of the Kuti Yankti River as part of their territory. To make it worse, on June 13, a bill seeking to give legal status to the new map was unanimously approved by the lower house in the Nepal Parliament.

The political struggle within the ruling party in Nepal further complicated the issue.

The Border in the 1950s

Interestingly, in the early 1950s, the Indian police already manned a check post at Kalapani. In his diary, Lakshman Singh Jangpangi, the Indian Trade Agent in Gartok, wrote: “July 10, 1955. I could not start on 9th, as my clerk suddenly ran a very high temperature and was unable to leave his bed. The Compounder was sent with the advance party on 6th. This clerk was today better and fit to travel, I started and camped at Kalapani Police Post. A section of P.A.C. [Provincial Armed Constabulary] under Subedar Sher Singh has been stationed here since June 28, 1955. The Garbyang villagers have cultivated land close to the post.”

When the police post was set up by the Uttar Pradesh government, probably in 1952, Nepal did not object.

The 1961 Sino-Nepal Treaty

But there is more, the “Boundary Treaty between the People’s Republic of China and the Kingdom of Nepal,” signed by President Liu Shaoqi of China and King Mahendra of Nepal on October 5, 1961, shows the Kali River as per the Indian stand. Article I (1) defines the China-Nepal boundary line, which “starts from the point where the watershed between the Kali River and the Tinkar River meets the watershed between the tributaries of the Mapchu (Karnali) River on the one hand and the Tinkar River on the other hand”.

More telling are the precise maps attached to the treaty and signed by both parties; Kathmandu seems to have forgotten that the location of the river on the maps of the Sino-Nepali treaty matches with the Indian stand: Kalapani is on Indian territory.

Other Proofs in Favour of India’s Stand

The Memorandum between the Government of the Republic of India and the Government of the People’s Republic of China on the Resumption of Border Trade, signed on December 13, 1991, and the Protocol on Entry and Exit Procedures for Border Trade, signed on July 1, 1992, are other examples confirming that China agreed with India on the border in this area.

For Beijing, the border pass was (and still is today) Lipulekh. Once again, Kathmandu did not protest.

The Chinese Stakes

Though China does not have any claim in the area, it is clear that Chinese have been inciting Nepal to claim Kalapani and beyond, and this is probably to destabilise India.

The visit of Wang Junzheng, the TAR party secretary, to Kathmandu last November set the ball rolling. The Tibet delegation (without any Tibetans) announced that they wanted to maintain the “good momentum of high-level exchanges between the two countries”. During his stay, Wang met, among others, Prime Minister Pushpa Kamal Dahal ‘Prachanda’.

A five-year initiative for Nepal’s northern border districts was then created; it offered different kinds of logistical and material support, mostly for building schools and health posts, installing solar electricity in the 15 northern districts of Nepal.

A preparatory meeting was recently held in Lhasa on April 23 and 24; all this means a more important Chinese presence in Nepal, including in Darchula district (of Nepal), bordering India.

Besides these political aspects, the stunning and majestic beauty of the area (particularly the Om Parvat and the Adi Kailash) will hopefully attract more and more Indian visitors in the years to come. After all, it is Indian territory.
translated: काली नदी पर नेपाल के क्षीण दावा के समीप चीन-नेपाल सीमा पर पहिल स्तंभ जमीनी यथार्थ में कोनो बदलाव नै करत, मुदा भारत सतर्कता अवश्य अछि काठमांडू बिसरि गेल बुझाइत अछि जे सिनो-नेपाली संधि के नक्शा पर काली नदी के स्थान के संग मेल खाइत अछि। भारतीय स्टैंड : कालपानी भारतीय क्षेत्र पर अछि।छवि : विकिमीडिया कॉमन्स भारत-तिब्बत सीमा केरऽ मध्य क्षेत्र केरऽ सीमावर्ती क्षेत्रऽ के हाल केरऽ यात्रा एगो आंखऽ के खुलऽ वाला छेलै ।पहिल बात जे हम एहि सुदूर स्थान पर ‘दुनिया’ सं जुड़बाक लेल केंद्र सरकार (भारतक सेनाक सीमावर्ती संगठनक माध्यम सं) द्वारा कयल गेल पर्याप्त प्रयास केने रही.पश्चिमी तिब्बत के गार्टोक में गारटोक में पोस्ट कयल गेल तिब्बत के पास कठोर इलाका के वर्णन के लेल 1930 के दशक में, यात्रिस (कीलश पर्वत के लेल) यात्रिस (कीलश पर्वत के लेल), या भारतीय अधिकारी सब के पास यात्री, योगी (विशेष रूप सं स्वामी प्रणावानाडा) के विवरण, तिब्बत , आ नेपाल;हाल धरि यात्रा सचमुच अत्यंत खतरनाक छल ।एकटा उदाहरण देबय लेल, किछु साल पहिने, ई 27 दिनक पैदल यात्रा पर एकटा यत्रीक लेल डार्चुला सं लिप्यूलेख धरि यात्रा करय लगलाह आ बाद में वापस आबि (तिब्बत में, हुनका लोकनि कें बस द्वारा कैलाश बेस कैंप धरि ल गेल गेलनि).आइ ई सड़क लिप्युलेखक चोटी सं किछु सौ मीटर दूर, तिब्बतमें पुरांग काउंटी (ड्ज़ॉन्ग) सं कुमाओन (तिब्बत आ नेपाल सं त्रिपक्षक समीप) कें अलग करैत अछि.डार्चुला आरू लिप्युलेख के बीच के सड़क के कारी-टॉपिंग अभी पूरा तरह स॑ पूरा नै होय सकलऽ छै, लेकिन ई कुछ महीना आरू के बात छै कि टार क॑ पास तक बिछैलऽ जाय छै ।एहि विकासक निहितार्थ ई अछि जे भारतीय सेना आ इंडो-टिब्बत सीमा पुलिस (आईटीबीपी) धरि पहुँच कहीं बेसी आसान अछि ;आइ रक्षा बल कम सं कम समय मे कोनो आकस्मिकता के जवाब द सकैत अछि, जाहि सं स्थानीय आबादी के जीवन सेहो सरल भ जाइत अछि.भले ही चीन के साथ 1962 के युद्ध के दौरान ई क्षेत्र कोनो टकराव के गवाह नै छेलै आरू बीजिंग द्वारा सीधा दावा नै करलऽ गेलऽ छै, लेकिन चीन के प्रॉक्सी नेपाल के माध्यम स॑ ई ‘विधाजनक’ बनलऽ रहै छै ।खबर में फेरू ई मुद्दा हाल ही में खबर में छेलै जबे काठमांडू न॑ नेपाल, लिम्पियाघुरा, आरू कलापानी केरऽ तथाकथित विवादित क्षेत्रऽ क॑ नेपाली केरऽ इलाका के हिस्सा के रूप म॑ शामिल करी क॑ नेपाल केरऽ एगो नया राजनीतिक नक्शा क॑ शामिल करै के फैसला करलकै ।विदेश मंत्री एस जयशंकर जल्दी जवाब देलनि: “हम ओ रिपोर्ट देखलहुं।हम एकरा विस्तार स नहि देखलहुं, मुदा हमरा लगैत अछि जे हमर सबहक स्थिति बहुत स्पष्ट अछि।नेपाल के साथ हमरा सब के एकटा स्थापित मंच के माध्यम स अपन सीमा के मामला के बारे में चर्चा भ रहल छल।आ तखन ओहि बीच मे ओ सभ एकतरफा किछु उपाय अपन कात मे लेलनि ।लेकिन अपनऽ तरफ कुछ करी क॑ [निपाल] हमरा सिनी के बीच के स्थिति या जमीन प॑ वास्तविकता के बीच के स्थिति बदलै वाला नै छै,’’ जयशंकर न॑ कहलकै ।नेपाल, जे आब एकतरफा नक्शा बदलबाक प्रयास करैत अछि, सदिखन भारतीय गाम कलापानीक दावा नहि करैत रहल अछि, जे काली नदीक मुख्य पुनरुत्थान अछि, जकर उत्पत्ति लिप्यूलेखक समीप एकटा रिवेट मे अछि ।मई 2020 में भारत आ नेपाल के बीच एकटा तर्क भड़कल;एकर तत्काल कारण छल डार्चुला सं लिप्यूलेख धरि 80 किलोमीटर सड़क.सामरिक रूप स॑ ई सड़क भारत लेली बहुत महत्वपूर्ण छै, लेकिन यात्रि आरू स्थानीय व्यापारी लेली भी महत्वपूर्ण छै, लिप्यूलेख भारत आरू तिब्बत के बीच तीनों भूमि पोर्टलऽ म॑ स॑ एक छै ।1998 के समय ही बम देव गौतम के नेतृत्व में सीपीएन-एमएल गुट के नेपाली के रूप में कलापानी के आसपास के कुछ भारतीय क्षेत्र के दावा करना शुरू करलऽ गेलै ।भूमि सर्वेक्षण विभाग केरऽ पूर्व महानिदेशक बुद्धि नारायण श्रेथ के अनुसार, ‘कली नदी’ कुति यांकी नदी छेलै जे लिम्पियाधुर केरऽ सीमा के नीचें निचा उठै छै आरू भारत द्वारा स्वीकार करलऽ गेलऽ काली के नै;नेपाल तखन शुरू भेल जे 400 किमी2 के एकटा पूरा क्षेत्र अछि।मुदा नेपाल द्वारा पिछला 150 साल धरि कोनो दावा किएक नहि राखल गेल?एकरऽ व्याख्या काठमांडू न॑ कहियो नै करलकै, आरू कुछ फीका ऐतिहासिक बहाना के प्रयोग आज भी करलऽ जाय रहलऽ छै ।नेपाली तर्क ई छै कि कुटी नदी केरऽ प्रवाह अधिक महत्वपूर्ण छै, हालांकि ई कुछ सिद्ध नै करै छै ।अपनऽ पुस्तक, हिस्ट्री ऑफ द लैश-मंसरोवर, स्वामी प्रणावनान्दा म॑, जे व्यापक रूप स॑ ई विषय प॑ लिखलकै, काली आरू कुटी नदी केरऽ संगम के उल्लेख करलकै “सड़क के नीचें 2 या 3 फरलोंग के दूरी प॑ ।भले ही कुटी नदी लगभग दू-दू बेर काली केरऽ होय छै, लेकिन काली क॑ मुख्य नदी मानलऽ जाय छै।”स्वामी न॑ ई भी नोट करलकै कि गारबियांग गाँव स॑ जुड़लऽ स्थानीय आबादी नेपाली स्टॉक के नै छै ।1814 में ब्रिटिश भारत आ नेपाल के बीच युद्ध के बाद इतिहास के पता लगाबैत, नेपालिस के वापस काली नदी के पार में मई 1815 में भेजल गेल छल, आ तत्पश्चात, सुगौली संधि के हस्ताक्षर 4 मार्च, 1816 के भेल छल.संधि के अनुच्छेद 5 में कहल गेल छल: “ नेपौल केरऽ राजा अपनऽ, अपनऽ उत्तराधिकारी आरू उत्तराधिकारी, सब काली नदी केरऽ पश्चिम में पड़लऽ देशऽ के दावा करै छै या ओकरऽ संबंध में त्याग करै छै, आरो वू देशऽ या ओकरऽ निवासी के साथ कभी भी कोनो चिंता नै करै छै।”दुर्भाग्यवश कोनो नक्शा नहि लागल छल, जे आधिकारिक तौर पर काली नदीक सटीक संरेखण आ स्रोत देखाओल जा सकैत छल ।कोनो हालत में, ओहि समय में, नामक लायक कोनो वैज्ञानिक सर्वेक्षण नहिं कयल जा सकैत छल ;19वीं शताब्दी के मध्य तक ही हिमालयी सीमा के सर्वोत्तम सर्वेक्षण भारत के महान त्रिकोणीय सर्वेक्षण (भारत के सर्वेक्षण के पूर्ववर्ती) द्वारा करलऽ गेलऽ छेलै, जेकरा म॑ अधिक वैज्ञानिक तरीका स॑ छेलै ।आइ नेपालिस अपन दावा एकटा पुरान नक्शा पर आधारित करैत अछि जे ने सटीक अछि आ ने प्रामाणिक ।1998 स॑ 2020 तलक नेपाली सरकार न॑ शांत रहै के काम जारी रखलकै, लेकिन मई 2020 म॑ काठमांडू न॑ पहलऽ बार न॑ अपनऽ इलाका के हिस्सा के रूप म॑ कुटी यांकी नदी के पूर्व म॑ पूरा क्षेत्र क॑ शामिल करी क॑ नक्शा जारी करलकै ।एकरा आरू खराब करै लेली 13 जून क॑ नया नक्शा क॑ कानूनी दर्जा दै के कोशिश करै वाला एगो विधेयक क॑ नेपाल केरऽ संसद म॑ निचला सदन द्वारा सर्वसम्मति स॑ मंजूरी देलऽ गेलै ।नेपाल मे सत्ताधारी दल क भीतर राजनीतिक संघर्ष एहि मुद्दा कए आओर जटिल बना देलक।1950 के दशक के सीमा दिलचस्प बात ई छै कि 1950 के दशक के शुरुआत में भारतीय पुलिस पहिने सं कालपानी में एकटा चेक पोस्ट के मैनेज करलकै.अपनऽ डायरी म॑ गार्टोक केरऽ भारतीय ट्रेड एजेंट लक्ष्मण सिंह जंगपांगी न॑ लिखलकै: “10 जुलाई, 1955. हम्में 9 तारीख स॑ शुरू नै करी सकै छेलियै, कैन्हेंकि हमरऽ लिपिक अचानक बहुत अधिक तापमान चलाबै छेलै आरू अपनऽ बिस्तर स॑ बाहर निकलै म॑ असमर्थ छेलै ।6 तारीख के अग्रिम पार्टी के संग कम्पाउन्डर भेजल गेल।ई चपरासी आइ नीक आ यात्रा करबा लेल फिट छल, हम कालपानी पुलिस पोस्ट पर शुरू केलहुं आ डेरा खसा लेलहुं.सुलार शेर सिंह के अंतर्गत पीएसी [प्रांतीय सशस्त्र सिंहता] के एक खंड 28 जून, 1955 स एतय तैनात अछि।गर्ब्यांग गाम के लोक एहि पद के नजदीक जमीन के खेती केने छथि।”जखन पुलिस पोस्ट के उत्तर प्रदेश सरकार द्वारा स्थापित कयल गेल छल, संभवतः 1952 में, नेपाल के कोनो आपत्ति नहिं छल.1961 के चीन-नेपाल संधि मुदा एहि सं बेसी अछि, “पीपुल्स रिपब्लिक ऑफ चाइना आ नेपाल के बीच सीमा संधि”, चीन के राष्ट्रपति लियू शओकी आ 5 अक्टूबर, 1961 के नेपाल के राजा महेन्द्र के द्वारा हस्ताक्षरित काली नदी के देखाओल गेल अछि. भारतीय स्टैंड के अनुसार।लेख I (1) चीन-नेपल सीमा रेखा के परिभाषित करैत अछि, जे “कली नदी आ टिनकर नदी के बीच जल विभाजन ओहि बिन्दु स शुरू करैत अछि जे एक हाथ आ टिनकर पर मपचू (कर्नाली) नदी के सहायक नदी के बीच जल विभाजन स मिलैत अछि दोसर दिस नदी”।बेसी कहब संधि सं जुड़ल आ दुनू पक्षक हस्ताक्षरित सटीक नक्शा;काठमाण्डू ई बिसरि गेल बुझाइत अछि जे चीन-नेपाली संधिक नक्शा पर नदीक स्थान भारतीय स्टैंडक संग मेल खाइत अछि : कलापानी भारतीय क्षेत्र पर अछि |भारत गणतंत्र सरकार आरू सीमा व्यापार के पुनः आरंभ पर जनगणराज्य सरकार सरकार के बीच भारत केरऽ ज्ञापन के पक्ष म॑ अन्य प्रमाण, 13 दिसंबर, 1991 क॑ हस्ताक्षर करलऽ गेलऽ छेलै, आरू सीमा के लेलऽ प्रवेश आरू निकास प्रक्रिया पर प्रोटोकॉल प॑ हस्ताक्षर करलऽ गेलऽ छै । 1 जुलाई, 1992 क॑ हस्ताक्षरित व्यापार, ई बात के पुष्टि करी रहलऽ छै कि चीन ई क्षेत्र म॑ सीमा प॑ भारत स॑ सहमत छै ।बीजिंग के लेल सीमा पास छल (आ एखनो अछि) लिप्यूलेख.एक बेर फेर काठमाण्डू विरोध नहि केलक।चीन केरऽ दांव भले ही ई क्षेत्र म॑ कोनो दावा नै छै, लेकिन ई साफ छै कि चीनी नेपाल क॑ कलापानी आरू ओकरा बाद के दावा करै लेली उकसाबै छै, आरू ई संभवतः भारत क॑ अस्थिर करै लेली छै ।पिछला नवंबर म॑ काठमांडू केरऽ टार पार्टी केरऽ सचिव वांग जुन्ज़ेंग केरऽ दौरा न॑ गेंद क॑ रोलिंग करी देलकै ।तिब्बत प्रतिनिधिमंडल (बिना कोनो तिब्बती) न॑ घोषणा करलकै कि हुनी “दुनू देशऽ के बीच उच्च स्तरीय आदान-प्रदान केरऽ अच्छा गति क॑ कायम रखना चाहै छै ।अपनऽ ठहरला के दौरान वांग स॑ अन्य लोगऽ के साथ प्रधानमंत्री पुष्पा कमल दहल ‘प्रचंडा’ स॑ भेंट करलऽ गेलै ।तखन नेपाल के उत्तरी सीमा जिला के लेल पांच साल के पहल के निर्माण भेल;ई अलग-अलग तरह के रसद आरू सामग्री सहायता के पेशकश करलकै, जेकरा म॑ अधिकतर स्कूल आरू स्वास्थ्य पदऽ के निर्माण लेली, नेपाल केरऽ 15 उत्तरी जिला म॑ सौर बिजली के स्थापना करलऽ गेलऽ छेलै ।23 आ 24 अप्रैल कए ल्हासा मे हाल मे एकटा तैयारीक बैसार भेल छल;ई सब के मतलब छै नेपाल में चीनी उपस्थिति, जेकरा में भारत के सीमा में डार्चुला जिला (नेपाल के) शामिल छै.ई राजनीतिक पहलू के अलावा, ई क्षेत्र केरऽ आश्चर्यजनक आरू राजसी सौंदर्य (विशेष रूप स॑ ओम पार्वत आरू आदि कैलाश) आशा छै कि आबै वाला सालऽ म॑ अधिक स॑ अधिक भारतीय आगंतुक क॑ आकर्षित करतै ।आखिर ई भारतीय इलाका अछि।
label: Opinion

title: Janata Samajbadi Party Nepal quits coalition government - World - Chinadaily.com.cn - China Daily
description: Janata Samajbadi Party Nepal quits coalition government - World - Chinadaily.com.cn  China Daily
publisher.title: China Daily
full_article:
KATHMANDU - Janata Samajbabi Party Nepal on Monday quit the coalition government, one week after the party was split.

Deputy Prime Minister and Minister for Health and Population Upendra Yadav, leader of the party, and Deepak Karki, state minister for health and population from the party, tendered their resignations to Prime Minister Pushpa Kamal Dahal.

The party said in a statement that it quit the government because of the changed political context.

On May 6, Ashok Rai, federal council chair of Janata Samajbadi Party Nepal, registered a new Janata Samajbadi Party with seven lawmakers. This move left Yadav with only five lawmakers.

On Sunday, the Communist Party of Nepal (Unified Marxist Leninist) and Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist Center) led by Dahal withdrew their support to the government in Madhesh Province led by Yadav's party.

Dahal formed a new coalition government in early March after breaking coalition with the Nepali Congress and rejoining hands with the CPN-UML.
translated: काठमांडू - जनाता समाजबाबी पार्टी नेपाल सोमदिन गठबंधन सरकार छोड़ि देलखिन, जे पार्टी के बंटवारा के एक सप्ताह बाद अछि।पार्टी केरऽ नेता उपप्रधानमंत्री आरू स्वास्थ्य आरू जनसंख्या उपप्रधानमंत्री उपेन्द्र यादव आरू पार्टी केरऽ राज्य केरऽ स्वास्थ्य आरू जनसंख्य मंत्री दीपक कार्की न॑ प्रधानमंत्री पुष्पा कमल दहल क॑ अपनऽ इस्तीफा के निविदा करलकै ।पार्टी न॑ एक बयान म॑ कहलकै कि बदललऽ राजनीतिक संदर्भ के वजह स॑ सरकार छोड़ी देलकै ।6 मई कए जनता समजबादी पार्टी नेपाल क संघीय परिषद क अध्यक्ष अशोक राय सातटा विधायक क संग एकटा नव जनता समाज पार्टी क पंजीकृत केलथि।एहि कदम स यादव कए मात्र पांचटा विधायक क संग छोड़ि देल गेल।रविदिन नेपाल के कम्युनिस्ट पार्टी (यूनिफाइड मार्क्सवादी लेनिनवादी) आ नेपाल (माओवादी केंद्र) के कम्युनिस्ट पार्टी के नेतृत्व में दहल नेदव के पार्टी के नेतृत्व में मधेश प्रांत में सरकार के अपन समर्थन वापस ल लेलक।नेपाली कांग्रेस के साथ गठबंधन तोड़ला के बाद आरू सीपीएन-यूएमएल के साथ हाथऽ में शामिल होय के बाद मार्च के शुरूआत में दाहल न॑ एगो नया गठबंधन सरकार के गठन करलकै ।

title: Nepal President's advisor who called currency with map of areas in India 'inappropriate', quits - Firstpost
description: Nepal President's advisor who called currency with map of areas in India 'inappropriate', quits  Firstpost
publisher.title: Firstpost
full_article:
Nepal President Ram Chandra Paudel’s economic advisor, Chiranjivi Nepal, has resigned following his controversial remarks on the government’s decision to issue new hundred-rupee notes with a map that includes three Indian territories.

As per the press release issued by the Office of the President, Paudel approved Chiranjivi’s resignation on Sunday.

Last week, during a Cabinet meeting in Nepal, it was decided to replace the old map with the new one while printing new notes of Rs 100.

Advertisement

The new map includes territories such as Kalapani, Lipulekh and Limpiyadhura.

India maintains Lipulekh, Kalapani and Limpiyadhura belong to it.

Nepal central bank’s ex-governor, Chiranjivi, had reportedly termed the government’s decision to print the new map on the notes as “an inappropriate move”.

What Chiranjivi Nepal said in his resignation letter?

“I have raised this serious issue to draw the public attention as it might cause practical problems to the people," Chiranjivi said in his resignation letter, PTI quoted an aide to the president saying on condition of anonymity.

“I have tendered my resignation from the post to maintain the dignity of the honourable President, as attempts were made to unnecessarily drag the president into controversy citing my statement,” Chiranjivi Nepal pointed out.

window._taboola=window._taboola||[],_taboola.push({mode:"thumbnails-mid-article",container:"taboola-mid-article-thumbnails",placement:"Mid Article Thumbnails",target_type:"mix"})

A group of civil society leaders had earlier demanded Chiranjivi’s removal over his remarks against the government’s decision to print new hundred-rupee notes with the map of Nepal as per the amended Constitution.

They argued that Chiranjivi had gone against national interest and breached decorum while speaking to the national and international media on the matter.

When Nepal changed its map?

In May 2020, the government led by the prime minister KP Sharma Oli unveiled Nepal’s new political map with the inclusion of Lipulek, Kalapani and Limpiyadhura areas within its territory.

The map was later endorsed by the Parliament unanimously.

Soon after the Nepal’s government started to replace the old map in all the official documents with the new one despite India’s objection.

Advertisement

How did India object?

After Nepal formally accepted its new map, the India’s Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) had said: “This artificial enlargement of claims is not based on historical fact or evidence and is not tenable. It is also violative of our current understanding to hold talks on outstanding boundary issues.”

Last week, India’s External Affairs Minister (EAM) S Jaishankar expressed discontent over the Nepal government’s decision to issue the new notes. He said it is not going to change the situation on the ground.

Nepal shares a border of over 1,850 km with five Indian states – Sikkim, West Bengal, Bihar, Uttar Pradesh and Uttarakhand.

title: Hyundai’s Nepal plant commences assembly of Venue - The Financial Express
description: Hyundai’s Nepal plant commences assembly of Venue  The Financial Express
publisher.title: The Financial Express
full_article:
Hyundai India and Laxmi Group announced the commencement of the local assembly of Hyundai Venue in Nepal. The country’s first automobile assembly plant was inaugurated by Pushpa Kamal Dahal, the Prime Minister of Nepal, and Tae-Young Park, Ambassador of the Republic of Korea, in Nepal on May 10, 2024.

Commenting on the commencement of assembly, Unsoo Kim, MD & CEO – Hyundai Motor India Limited said, “This plant in Nepal has an installed capacity of assembling 5,000 units annually, and Hyundai VENUE will be the first locally assembled model to roll off the plant. I would like to convey my sincere congratulations to the people of Nepal for this achievement!”

Also Read Maruti offering heavy discounts on older Swift: Here’s how much it will cost you

Kim added, “We are immensely grateful to the Hon’ble Prime Minister Shri. Pushpa Kamal Dahal and the Government of Nepal for their unwavering support. We look forward to more encouraging policies and incentives from the Nepal Government aimed at developing a conducive environment for local assembly.”

Also Read Here’s a look at Sudha Reddy’s custom Rolls-Royce From Mercedes S Class to Rolls Royce Cullinan: Isha Ambani’s car collection MG 100-Year Limited Edition range launched in India Toyota Innova Crysta gets new mid-spec GX+ trim, priced at Rs 21.39 lakh

While Laxmi Group will make and sell Hyundai cars in Nepal, customers can be assured of continued satisfaction and customer experience, with continued collaboration and support on products, technology and quality projects from HMC Korea and Hyundai Motor India.

Hyundai Motor and Laxmi Group’s industry-first vehicle assembly plant in the country will pave the way for promoting localization and employment generation.
translated: हुंडई इंडिया आ लक्ष्मी ग्रुप नेपाल के हुंडई स्थल के स्थानीय सभा के प्रारंभ के घोषणा केलक अछि.देश केरऽ पहलऽ ऑटोमोबाइल विधानसभा संयंत्र केरऽ उद्घाटन नेपाल केरऽ प्रधानमंत्री पुष्पा कमल दहल आरू कोरिया गणराज्य केरऽ राजदूत ताए-यंग पार्क न॑ १० मई २०२४ क॑ नेपाल म॑ करलकै । एमडी एंड सीईओ – हुंडई मोटर इंडिया लिमिटेड न॑ कहलकै, “नेपाल म॑ ई संयंत्र म॑ सालाना ५,००० यूनिट क॑ इकट्ठा करै के स्थापित क्षमता छै, आरू हुंडई केरऽ आयोजन स्थल न॑ संयंत्र क॑ रोल ऑफ करै वाला पहिलऽ स्थानीय रूप स॑ एकत्रित मॉडल होतै ।हम एहि उपलब्धि लेल नेपाल के लोक के अपन निश्छल बधाई देबय चाहब !”साथ ही पढ़लऽ गेलऽ मारुति क॑ पुरानऽ स्विफ्ट प॑ भारी छूट के पेशकश करलऽ गेलऽ छै: यहाँ ई बात छै कि आपने क॑ किम न॑ जोड़लऽ गेलऽ छै, “हम॑ माननीय प्रधानमंत्री श्री के प्रति अथाह आभारी छियै ।पुष्पा कमल दहल आ नेपाल सरकार अपन अटूट समर्थन लेल।हम नेपाल सरकार केरऽ अधिक उत्साहजनक नीति आरू प्रोत्साहन के इंतजार करी रहलऽ छियै जेकरऽ उद्देश्य स्थानीय सभा लेली अनुकूल वातावरण विकसित करना छै।”इहो पढ़ू एतय मर्सिडीज एस क्लास सं सुधा रेड्डी के कस्टम रोल्स-रॉयस पर रोल्स रॉयस कलिना: इशा अम्बानी के कार संग्रह एमजी 100-वर्ष सीमित संस्करण रेंज भारत में लॉन्च कएल गेल टोयोटा इनोवा क्रिस्टा के नव मिड-स्पेक जीएक्स+ ट्रिम मिलैत अछि, जेकर कीमत रुपया 21.39 रुपया पर अछि. लाख जखन कि लक्ष्मी ग्रुप नेपाल म॑ हुंडई कार बनाबै आरू बेचतै, ग्राहकऽ क॑ निरंतर संतुष्टि आरू ग्राहकऽ के अनुभव के आश्वासन देलऽ जाब॑ सकै छै, जेकरा म॑ एचएमसी कोरिया आरू हुंडई मोटर इंडिया केरऽ उत्पाद, तकनीक आरू गुणवत्ता परियोजना प॑ निरंतर सहयोग आरू समर्थन के साथ आश्वासन देलऽ जाब॑ सकै छै ।हुंडई मोटर आरू लैक्सी ग्रुप केरऽ उद्योग-पहिलऽ वाहन विधानसभा संयंत्र देश म॑ स्थानीयकरण आरू रोजगार केरऽ उत्पादन क॑ बढ़ावा दै के रास्ता प्रशस्त करतै ।

Hyundai Motor India with Laxmi Group begins assembly of Venue in Nepal

The country’s first automobile assembly plant was inaugurated by Pushpa Kamal Dahal, the Prime Minister of Nepal, and Tae-Young Park, Ambassador of the Republic of Korea, in Nepal, on May 10, 2024. The assembly plant has an annual installed capacity of 5000 units, Hyundai said.

title: Hyundai & Laxmi Group Launch Nepal’s First Automobile Assembly Plant - Mobility Outlook
description: Hyundai & Laxmi Group Launch Nepal’s First Automobile Assembly Plant  Mobility Outlook
publisher.title: Mobility Outlook
full_article:
Hyundai Motor India Limited (HMIL) in collaboration with Laxmi Group, marks a milestone in Nepal’s automotive industry by commencing the local assembly of the Hyundai VENUE at Nepal’s first automobile assembly plant. With an installed capacity of assembling 5,000 units annually, the plant is set to enhance the availability of Hyundai vehicles in Nepal, starting with the Hyundai VENUE as the inaugural model to be locally assembled.

Unsoo Kim, MD & CEO of Hyundai Motor India Limited stated “This plant in Nepal has an installed capacity of assembling 5,000 units annually, and Hyundai VENUE will be the first locally assembled model to roll off the plant. I would like to convey my sincere congratulations to the people of Nepal for this achievement!”

The successful establishment of the plant has been facilitated by support from the Nepalese government and the active involvement of the Laxmi Group, a prominent local partner. This collaborative effort underscores a shared vision for advancing Nepal’s automotive industry and integrating it into global supply chains.

“We are immensely grateful to the Prime Minister Pushpa Kamal Dahal and the Government of Nepal for their unwavering support. We look forward to more encouraging policies and incentives from the Nepal Government aimed at developing a conducive environment for local assembly,” added Kim.

The initiative is set to promote localisation of the automotive industry in Nepal, reducing the dependency on imports and fostering a self-sustaining industrial environment. The local assembly operations are expected to create direct and indirect job opportunities, contributing to the economic development of the region.

title: Nepal President's economic advisor quits after remark on country's Rs 100 notes - India Today
description: Nepal President's economic advisor quits after remark on country's Rs 100 notes  India Today
publisher.title: India Today
full_article:
The economic advisor to Nepal's President Ram Chandra Paudel has resigned after his controversial remarks on the government’s decision to issue new hundred-rupee notes with a map that includes three Indian territories, a move already rejected by India.

The President approved Chiranjivi Nepal's resignation on Sunday, according to a press release issued by the Office of the President.

“I made the remarks as an economist and a former governor of the central bank but some news media have twisted it in an attempt to unnecessarily drag the respectful institution of the president into controversy, which made me feel sad,” Chiranjivi Nepal PTI on Monday.

advertisement

The new map includes territories such as Kalapani, Lipulekh and Limpiyadhura.

India maintains Lipulekh, Kalapani and Limpiyadhura belong to it.

“I, therefore, tendered my resignation taking the moral obligation of the attempt made by some online news portals which have tried to drag the president into controversy based on my statement,” he said.

“My intention in the statement was just to make people aware as a conscious citizen that such acts could create practical problems to the country and the people at a time when discussions are underway at diplomatic levels (on the map),” he clarified.

A Cabinet meeting last week decided to replace the old map with the new one while printing new notes of Rs 100.

CPN-UML chairman and former Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli had publicly criticised Chiranjivi Nepal for his remarks.

Earlier, a group of civil society leaders had demanded the removal of Chiranjivi Nepal over his remarks against the government's decision to print new hundred-rupee notes with the map of Nepal as per the amended Constitution.

They argued that he had gone against national interest and breached decorum while speaking to the national and international media on the matter.

Nepal's government unveiled its new political map with the inclusion of Lipulek, Kalapani and Limpiyadhura areas within its territory in May 2020 during the government led by Oli. It was later endorsed by the Parliament unanimously. After that, the government replaced the old map used in all the official documents with the new map despite India’s objection.

“This artificial enlargement of claims is not based on historical fact or evidence and is not tenable. It is also violative of our current understanding to hold talks on outstanding boundary issues," India's External Affairs Ministry said at that time.

External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar last week expressed discontent over the Nepal government's decision to issue the new notes.

Jaishankar said that it is not going to change the situation on the ground.

Nepal shares a border of over 1,850 km with five Indian states – Sikkim, West Bengal, Bihar, Uttar Pradesh and Uttarakhand.

title: Nepalese President's Economic Advisor Resigns After Criticising Prachanda Government Over New Currency Notes Showing Indian Territory - Swarajya
description: Nepalese President's Economic Advisor Resigns After Criticising Prachanda Government Over New Currency Notes Showing Indian Territory  Swarajya
publisher.title: Swarajya
full_article:
Chiranjivi Nepal, the economic advisor to Nepal's President Ram Chandra Paudel, resigned after his remarks on the government’s decision to issue new hundred-rupee notes featuring a map that includes territories disputed with India.

The Nepalese President accepted his resignation on Sunday, according to a press release from the Office of the President.

Nepal stated that his comments were intended to highlight potential practical issues arising from the inclusion of the territories of Kalapani, Lipulekh, and Limpiyadhura on the new notes, particularly at a time when diplomatic discussions regarding these areas are ongoing.

“I, therefore, tendered my resignation taking the moral obligation of the attempt made by some online news portals which have tried to drag the president into controversy based on my statement,” he said, news agency PTI reported.

His resignation comes after Nepal government last week decided to introduce a new Rs 100 currency note featuring Indian territory, rekindling tensions that arose four years ago when Nepal included Uttarakhand's Kalapani, Lipulekh, and Limpiyadhura in its map.

The announcement came from Nepal government spokesperson and Minister of Communication Rekha Sharma after a cabinet meeting chaired by Prime Minister Pushpa Kamal Dahal 'Prachanda.'

The move was criticised by India's External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar, who stated that it wouldn't alter the ground reality or the ongoing boundary discussions between the two countries.

“Our position is very clear. With Nepal, we are having discussions about our boundary matters through an established platform. In the middle of that, they unilaterally took some measures on their side," Jaishankar said, Indian Express reported.

Criticising the Prachanda government's decision, Chiranjibi Nepal, a former Governor of Rastra Bank and economic advisor to the President, questioned the decision's timing and potential consequences, emphasising the importance of international recognition.

“The decision of the government has come at the most inappropriate time and without thinking of its larger implications. Nepal being in dispute with India over certain parts of territory is one thing, but printing in the currency a map that is different from what the international bodies, including two neighbours, have recognised is unwise," Chiranjibi Nepal had said.

CPN-UML chairman and former Prime Minister K P Sharma Oli had publicly criticised Chiranjivi Nepal for his remarks.

The rift between India and Nepal deepened in 2020 when India inaugurated a new road from Dharchula to Lipulekh on the Mansarovar Yatra route in Uttarakhand.

This angered the then prime minister K P Sharma Oli led government in Kathmandu, which came out with a new map of Nepal, adding to it an area of 370 sq km at the tri-junction of Nepal, India and China which India maintains is its territory.

A Constitution amendment Bill was passed by Nepal’s Parliament to legitimise the modification to the country’s map with the addition of India territories of Kalapani, Lipulekh and Limpiyadhura.

The passage of the Bill and the new map led to a temporary breakdown of communication between the two countries.

The 2020 move had support of Nepal's political parties. However, the recent decision by the Prachand government has faced internal skepticism and criticism, including that of Chiranjibi Nepal.

translated: नेपाल केरऽ राष्ट्रपति राम चंद्र पौदेल केरऽ आर्थिक सलाहकार चिरंजीवी नेपाल न॑ सरकार केरऽ नयका सौ-रुपनी नोट जारी करै के फैसला प॑ अपनऽ टिप्पणी के बारे म॑ अपनऽ टिप्पणी के बाद इस्तीफा द॑ देलकै जेकरा म॑ एगो नक्शा छै जेकरा म॑ भारत स॑ विवादित क्षेत्र शामिल छै ।राष्ट्रपति केरऽ कार्यालय केरऽ प्रेस विज्ञप्ति के अनुसार नेपाली राष्ट्रपति न॑ रविवार क॑ अपनऽ इस्तीफा क॑ स्वीकार करी लेलकै ।नेपाल न॑ कहलकै कि हुनकऽ ई टिप्पणी के उद्देश्य छै कि कलापानी, लिप्यूलेख, आरू लिम्पियाधुरा केरऽ क्षेत्रऽ क॑ नयऽ नोटऽ प॑, खास करी क॑ ई क्षेत्रऽ के संबंध म॑ कूटनीतिक चर्चा जारी छै ।न्यूज एजेंसी पीटीआई न॑ कहलकै कि हम्में, यही लेली कुछ ऑनलाइन न्यूज पोर्टल द्वारा करलऽ गेलऽ प्रयास के नैतिक दायित्व लेली अपनऽ इस्तीफा क॑ निविदा करल॑ छेलियै जे हमरऽ बयान के आधार प॑ राष्ट्रपति क॑ विवाद म॑ घसीटै के कोशिश करलकै ।हुनकऽ इस्तीफा न॑ पिछला सप्ताह नेपाल सरकार न॑ भारतीय क्षेत्र क॑ देखाबै वाला एगो नया 100 रुपया नोट पेश करै के फैसला करलकै, जेकरा म॑ चारि साल पहलें तनाव पैदा होय गेलै जब॑ नेपाल न॑ अपनऽ नक्शा म॑ उत्तराखनी, लिप्यूलेख, आरू लिम्पियाधुरा क॑ शामिल करलकै ।ई घोषणा नेपाल सरकार के प्रवक्ता आरू संचार मंत्री रेखा शर्मा स॑ प्रधानमंत्री पुष्पा कमल दहल ‘प्रचंडा’ के अध्यक्षता के बाद करलऽ गेलऽ छेलै ।ई कदम के आलोचना भारत केरऽ विदेश मंत्री एस जयशंकर न॑ करलकै, जेकरा म॑ कहलऽ गेलऽ छेलै कि ई जमीनी वास्तविकता या दूनू देशऽ के बीच जारी सीमा चर्चा म॑ कोनो बदलाव नै करतै ।ओ कहला जे हमर स्थिति बहुत स्पष्ट अछि।नेपाल के साथ हमरा सब के एकटा स्थापित मंच के माध्यम स अपन सीमा के मामला के बारे में चर्चा भ रहल अछि।ओकरऽ बीच म॑ वू एकतरफा रूप स॑ अपनऽ तरफ कुछ उपाय करलकै,’’ जेशनकर न॑ कहलकै, इंडियन एक्सप्रेस न॑ रिपोर्ट करलकै ।प्राचंडा सरकार केरऽ फैसला के आलोचना करतें हुअ॑ प्रीरिता बैंक केरऽ पूर्व गवर्नर आरू राष्ट्रपति केरऽ आर्थिक सलाहकार चिरंजी नेपाल न॑ ई फैसला केरऽ समय प॑ सवाल उठैलकै आरू ई फैसला के समय प॑ सवाल उठैलकै आरू संभावित परिणाम, अंतर्राष्ट्रीय मान्यता के महत्व पर जोर देना सरकार के निर्णय सबसे अनुचित समय पर आ नेपाल के क्षेत्र के कुछ भागों पर विवाद में रहना एक बात एक बात है, लेकिन छापना एक बात है | मुद्रा जे नक्शा दू पड़ोसी सहित अंतरराष्ट्रीय निकाय स॑ अलग छै, ओकरा स॑ अलग छै, जेकरा स॑ ई बात के जानकारी नै छै ।'सीपीएन-यूएमएल के अध्यक्ष आरू पूर्व प्रधानमंत्री केपी शर्मा ओली न॑ हुनकऽ टिप्पणी लेली चिरनजीवी नेपाल के सार्वजनिक आलोचना करल॑ छेलै ।भारत आरू नेपाल के बीच के दरार 2020 म॑ गहरा होय गेलै जब॑ भारत न॑ उत्तराखंड केरऽ मानसारोवर यात्रा मार्ग प॑ धर्चुला स॑ लिप्यूलेख तलक के एगो नया सड़क के उद्घाटन करलकै ।ई तत्कालीन प्रधानमंत्री केपी शर्मा ओली के काठमांडू में सरकार के नेतृत्व में छल, जे नेपाल के एकटा नव नक्शा के संग निकलल छल, जाहि में नेपाल, भारत आ चीन के त्रि-जंक्शन पर 370 वर्ग किमी के क्षेत्र के जोड़ल गेल छल जे भारत के कहनाय अछि जे ओकर क्षेत्र अछि के .नेपाल केरऽ संसद न॑ कलपानी, लिप्यूलेख आरू लिम्पियाधुरा केरऽ भारत केरऽ क्षेत्रऽ के जोड़ला के साथ देश केरऽ नक्शा म॑ संशोधन क॑ वैध बनाबै लेली नेपाल केरऽ संसद न॑ पारित करलऽ गेलै ।विधेयक केरऽ पारित होय के कारण ई दूनू देशऽ के बीच संवाद केरऽ अस्थायी विभाजन होय ​​गेलै ।2020 के एहि कदम के नेपाल के राजनीतिक दल के समर्थन छल.लेकिन प्रचंड सरकार केरऽ हाल केरऽ फैसला म॑ चिरंजी नेपाल केरऽ आतंरिक संदेह आरू आलोचना के सामना करना पड़लऽ छै ।इहो पढ़ू: भारतीय क्षेत्रक संग नक्शा देखाबय लेल नेपाल मे नव मुद्रा नोट

title: Hyundai ties up with Laxmi Group to commence Venue production in Nepal - Moneycontrol
description: Hyundai ties up with Laxmi Group to commence Venue production in Nepal  Moneycontrol
publisher.title: Moneycontrol
full_article:
The plant, the first automotive assembly facility in Nepal, has an annual installed capacity of 5,000 units

Hyundai Motor India on Monday said it has commenced local assembly of its compact SUV Venue in Nepal in collaboration with Laxmi Group. New Delhi, May 13 Hyundai Motor India on Monday said it has commenced local assembly of its compact SUV Venue in Nepal in collaboration with Laxmi Group.

The plant, the first automotive assembly facility in Nepal, has an annual installed capacity of 5,000 units.

”Hyundai Venue will be the first locally assembled model to roll off the plant. I would like to convey my sincere congratulations to the people of Nepal for this achievement,” Hyundai Motor India MD & CEO Unsoo Kim said in a statement.

”Hyundai Venue will be the first locally assembled model to roll off the plant. I would like to convey my sincere congratulations to the people of Nepal for this achievement,” Hyundai Motor India MD & CEO Unsoo Kim said in a statement. The company is grateful to Nepal Prime Minister Pushpa Kamal Dahal and the Government of Nepal for their unwavering support for the facility, he added.

”We look forward to more encouraging policies and incentives from the Nepal Government aimed at developing a conducive environment for local assembly,” Kim said. Hyundai has partnered with Nepal-based Laxmi Group for the assembly plant.

title: In Setback To Prachanda-led Government, Nepal's Deputy PM Resigns - NDTV
description: In Setback To Prachanda-led Government, Nepal's Deputy PM Resigns  NDTV
publisher.title: NDTV
full_article:
The ruling coalition led by Prime Minister Prachanda still holds a majority (File)

Nepal's Deputy Prime Minister and senior Madhesi leader Upendra Yadav on Monday tendered his resignation and his party pulled out of the government in a setback to Prime Minister Pushpa Kamal Dahal Prachanda-led coalition government.

Upendra Yadav, also the Minister for Health and Population, submitted his resignation to Prime Minister "Prachanda" on Monday morning, according to sources close to the Madhesi leader. Along with Upendra Yadav, Minister of State for Forest and Environment Dipak Karki, from the same party, has also submitted his resignation.

The resignation by Upendra Yadav, the Chairman of Janata Samajwadi Party Nepal (JSP-Nepal), comes a week after his party split into two groups with senior leader Ashok Rai forming a new party named Janata Samajwadi Party. The new party has been recognised by the Election Commission.

window._rrCode = window._rrCode || [];_rrCode.push(function(){ (function(v,d,o,ai){ai=d.createElement("script");ai.defer=true;ai.async=true;ai.src=v.location.protocol+o;d.head.appendChild(ai);})(window, document, "//a.vdo.ai/core/v-ndtv/vdo.ai.js"); });

"This morning, I submitted my resignation to Prime Minister Dahal. Given the current political situation, I find it untenable to continue my cooperation with the government," Upendra Yadav said.

The JSP-Nepal had altogether 12 lawmakers in the House of Representatives (HoR). Now the party's strength has been reduced to 5 in the HoR as Rai and six other lawmakers and 30 central committee members joined the new party.

The ruling coalition led by Prime Minister Prachanda still holds a majority with 77 seats of the CPN-UML, 32 of the Maoist Centre, 21 of the Rastriya Swatantra Party, seven of the newly formed Janata Samajbadi Party and 10 seats of the CPN-Unified Socialist (CPN-US). The coalition requires at least 138 seats in the 275-member House of Representatives to prove a majority.

"The party's pull out from the government will not have an immediate impact on the Prachanda-led coalition government," said Sunil Manandhar, former environment minister and central committee member of the ruling CPN-Maoist Centre. However, it may have some repercussions on the stability of the government in the long term, he added.

There are reports that the Opposition Nepali Congress is trying to mobilise JSP-Nepal and CPN-US led by former prime minister Madhav Nepal to topple the Prachanda-led government. Nepali Congress is currently obstructing the proceedings of the House of Representatives demanding the resignation of Deputy Prime Minister and Home Minister Ravi Lamichhene, who is also the president of the Rastriya Swotantra Party over the issue of cooperative fund misappropriation.

जारी रखनाई असहनीय लगैत अछि।जेएसपी-नेपाल मे प्रतिनिधि सभा मे कुल मिला कए 12टा विधायक (होर) छल ।आब पार्टी केरऽ ताकत क॑ होर म॑ 5 करी देलऽ गेलऽ छै, कैन्हेंकि राय आरू छह अन्य विधायक आरू 30 केंद्रीय समिति के सदस्य नयका पार्टी म॑ शामिल होय गेलऽ छै ।प्रधानमंत्री प्रचंडा के नेतृत्व में सत्तारूढ़ गठबंधन के पास अखनी भी बहुमत छै, जेकरा में 77 सीट सीपीएन-यूएमएल के 77 सीट, माओवादी केंद्र के 32, रसद्य स्वातात्रा पार्टी के 21, नव गठित जनता समाज पार्टी में स सात आ सीपीएन-एकीकृत के 10 सीट के साथ। समाजवादी (CPN-US)।गठबंधन मे बहुमत साबित करय लेल 275 सदस्यीय प्रतिनिधि सभा मे कम सं कम 138 सीट के जरूरत अछि.सत्तारूढ़ सीपीएन-माओवादी केंद्र केरऽ पूर्व पर्यावरण मंत्री आरू केंद्रीय समिति के सदस्य सुनील माननारहर न॑ कहलकै कि सरकार स॑ बाहर निकलै के बाद प्रचंडा केरऽ नेतृत्व वाला गठबंधन सरकार प॑ तत्काल प्रभाव नै पड़तै ।मुदा, एकर दीर्घकालीन स्थिरता पर किछु प्रतिक्रिया भ सकैत अछि, ओ इहो कहलनि।खबर छै कि विपक्षी नेपाली कांग्रेस जेएसपी-नेपाल आरू सीपीएन-यूएस क॑ पूर्व प्रधानमंत्री माधव नेपाल के नेतृत्व म॑ प्रचंडा के नेतृत्व वाला सरकार क॑ गिरै लेली जुटाबै के कोशिश करी रहलऽ छै ।नेपाली कांग्रेस वर्तमान मे उप प्रधानमंत्री आ गृहमंत्री रवि लामिचेने के इस्तीफा देबय के मांग करय वाला प्रतिनिधि सभा के कार्यवाही मे बाधा पहुंचा रहल छथिन्ह जे सहकारी कोष के दुरुपयोग के मुद्दा पर रसिया स्वोतांत्र पार्टी के अध्यक्ष सेहो छथिन्ह.प्रचारित नवीनतम गीत सुनें, केवल jiosaavn.com पर विंडोज._rrcode = window._rrcode title: Nepali guide, UK mountaineer surpass their own records for most climbs of Mount Everest - Fox News
description: Nepali guide, UK mountaineer surpass their own records for most climbs of Mount Everest  Fox News
publisher.title: Fox News
full_article:
close Video Ovarian cancer survivors hike Mount Everest Arthel Neville speaks with Dr. Joanie Mayor Hope to discuss the excursion to Mount Everest to raise awareness for ovarian cancer on ’Fox News Live.’

British climber Kenton Cool, 50, and Nepali guide Kami Rita Sherpa, 54, have broken their own records for most climbs of Mount Everest.

Cool and Sherpa climbed the 29,032-foot peak for the 18th and 29th time, respectively.

Both climbers used the Southeast Ridge route, the most popular path to the Everest summit.

A British climber and a Nepali guide have broken their own records for most climbs of Mount Everest, the world's highest mountain, hiking officials said on Sunday.

Rakesh Gurung, director of Nepal's Department of Tourism, said Britain's Kenton Cool, 50, and Nepali guide Kami Rita Sherpa, 54, climbed the 29,032-foot peak for the 18th and 29th time, respectively.

They were on separate expeditions guiding their clients.

NEPAL SHERPA GUIDE SETS RECORD FOR MOST CLIMBS OF MOUNT EVEREST WITH 27

if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('mobile', 'ban2', 'mobile-mw-ad-ban2'); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

"He just keeps going and going... amazing guy!" Garrett Madison of the U.S.-based expedition organizing company Madison Mountaineering said of the Nepali climber. Madison had teamed up with Kami Rita to climb the summits of Everest, Lhotse, and K2 in 2014.

British climber Kenton Cool, 49, waves upon his arrival at the airport, as he returns after completing his 17th ascent of Mount Everest, which is the most by any foreign climber, in Kathmandu, Nepal, on May 19, 2023. (REUTERS/Navesh Chitrakar/File Photo)

K2, located in Pakistan, is the world's second-highest mountain and Lhotse in Nepal is the fourth-tallest.

Lukas Furtenbach of the Austrian expedition operator Furtenbach Adventures called Cool's feat remarkable.

if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('mobile', 'ban3', 'mobile-mw-ad-ban3'); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

"He is a fundamental part of the Everest guiding industry. Kenton Cool is an institution," Furtenbach, who is leading an expedition from the Chinese side of Everest, told Reuters.

CLICK HERE TO GET THE FOX NEWS APP

Both climbers used the Southeast Ridge route to the summit.

if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('mobile', 'ban4', 'mobile-mw-ad-ban4'); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

Pioneered by the first summiteers, New Zealander Sir Edmund Hillary and Sherpa Tenzing Norgay in 1953, the route remains the most popular path to the Everest summit.

Kami Rita first climbed Everest in 1994 and has done so almost every year since, except for three years when authorities closed the mountain for various reasons.

He climbed the mountain twice last year.

Mountain climbing is a major tourism activity and a source of income as well as employment for Nepal, home to eight of the world's 14 tallest peaks, including Everest.

Nepal has issued 414 permits, each costing $11,000 to climbers for the climbing season that ends this month.

title: Hyundai India Opens Its First Car Assembly Plant In Nepal; Rolls Out First Nepal-Made Venue - carandbike
description: Hyundai India Opens Its First Car Assembly Plant In Nepal; Rolls Out First Nepal-Made Venue  carandbike
publisher.title: carandbike
full_article:
The Hyundai Venue has become the first-ever Made-In-Nepal vehicle to be rolled out of what is also the country’s first vehicle assembly plant. Built in partnership with the company’s local partner Laxmi Group, Hyundai’s new assembly plant will have an annual installed capacity of 5000 units. The plant was inaugurated by Pushpa Kamal Dahal, Prime Minister of Nepal, and Tae-Young Park, Ambassador of the Republic of Korea, in Nepal on May 10, 2024.

Commenting on the commencement of vehicle assembly in Nepal, Unsoo Kim, MD & CEO - Hyundai Motor India Limited said, “We are immensely grateful to the Hon’ble Prime Minister Shri. Pushpa Kamal Dahal and the Government of Nepal for their unwavering support. We look forward to more encouraging policies and incentives from the Nepal Government aimed at developing a conducive environment for local assembly.”

Hyundai’s new assembly plant will have an annual installed capacity of 5000 units

Going forward, Laxmi Group will produce and sell Hyundai cars in Nepal, however, the company says that there will be continued collaboration and support on products, technology and quality projects from HMC Korea and Hyundai Motor India.

Hyundai has been India’s largest exporter of cars and Nepal has been a major market for the company. With this latest development, the companies also hope that the industry's first vehicle assembly plant in Nepal will also pave the way for promoting localisation and employment generation in the country.
translated: हुंडई स्थल पहिल बेर मेड-इन-नेपाल वाहन बनि गेल अछि जेकरा देश क पहिल वाहन विधानसभा संयंत्र क सेहो रोल आउट कैल गेल अछि।कंपनी के स्थानीय भागीदार लक्ष्मी ग्रुप के साथ साझेदारी में निर्मित हुंडई के नव विधानसभा संयंत्र के वार्षिक स्थापित क्षमता 5000 यूनिट होयत.नेपाल के प्रधानमंत्री पुष्पा कमल दहल के उद्घाटन आ कोरिया गणराज्य के राजदूत ताए-यंग पार्क 10 मई, 2024 के नेपाल में. सीईओ - हुंडई मोटर इंडिया लिमिटेड न॑ कहलकै, “हम॑ माननीय प्रधानमंत्री श्री केरऽ अपार आभारी छियै ।पुष्पा कमल दहल आ नेपाल सरकार अपन अटूट समर्थन लेल।हम नेपाल सरकार केरऽ अधिक उत्साहजनक नीति आरू प्रोत्साहन के इंतजार करी रहलऽ छियै जेकरऽ उद्देश्य स्थानीय सभा लेली अनुकूल वातावरण विकसित करना छै।”हुंडई केरऽ नया विधानसभा संयंत्र म॑ आगू जाय क॑ 5000 यूनिट केरऽ वार्षिक स्थापित क्षमता होतै, लक्ष्मी ग्रुप नेपाल म॑ हुंडई कारऽ के उत्पादन आरू बेचतै, हालांकि कंपनी के कहना छै कि एचएमसी कोरिया केरऽ उत्पाद, तकनीक आरू गुणवत्ता परियोजना प॑ निरंतर सहयोग आरू समर्थन होतै । आ हुंडई मोटर इंडिया।हुंडई भारत केरऽ सबस॑ बड़ऽ कारऽ के निर्यातक रहलऽ छै आरू नेपाल कंपनी लेली एगो प्रमुख बाजार रहलऽ छै ।ई ताजा विकास के साथ कंपनी सिनी क॑ ई भी उम्मीद छै कि नेपाल म॑ उद्योग केरऽ पहलऽ वाहन विधानसभा संयंत्र स॑ देश म॑ स्थानीयकरण आरू रोजगार उत्पादन क॑ बढ़ावा दै के रास्ता भी प्रशस्त करलऽ जैतै ।

title: Nepal's Annual Policy & Program Presentation at Federal Parliament Tomorrow - DD News
description: Nepal's Annual Policy & Program Presentation at Federal Parliament Tomorrow  DD News
publisher.title: DD News
full_article:
The government’s policy and programme document for the upcoming year for Nepal is being tabled at a joint meeting of the federal parliament on Tuesday. President of Nepal Ramchandra Paudel will address the joint meeting of the federal parliament at 3:00 pm on Tuesday to announce the government’s policy and programme for the fiscal year 2081/082 BS.

Assistant Spokesperson of Federal Parliament Secretariat Dasharath Dhamala shared that preparations for the joint meeting have been completed. The Federal Parliament Secretariat has extended invitations to Vice President Ramsahaya Prasad Yadav, Chief Justice Bishwambhar Prasad Shrestha and other dignitaries to attend the joint meeting of the House of Representatives and National Assembly.

Sweta Singh (Kathmandu)

title: Kathmandu shouldn’t politicise map dispute - Hindustan Times
description: Kathmandu shouldn’t politicise map dispute  Hindustan Times
publisher.title: Hindustan Times
full_article:
That year, Nepal’s Parliament passed a constitutional amendment to endorse a new political map that claimed the areas of Lipulekh, Kalapani and Limpiyadhura, which have for long been under India’s control. This was in response to the Indian side opening a strategic road connecting Dharchula and Lipulekh. The issue lingered like a dark cloud over bilateral relations till the two sides agreed to address the border issue through established mechanisms. The Indian side also made it clear that Nepal’s “artificial enlargement of claims” wasn’t based on historical fact and violated the existing understanding to address outstanding boundary issues through talks.

Besides the disputes over two stretches at Kalapani and Susta, the rest of the India-Nepal boundary has been settled. These boundary disputes ought to be discussed through existing mechanisms between the two governments and away from the public glare, so that contentious issues can be sorted out in a spirit of give and take. Unfortunately, that is not the direction in which Kathmandu appears to be moving.
translated: ओहि साल नेपाल के संसद एकटा नव राजनीतिक नक्शा के समर्थन करय लेल संवैधानिक संशोधन पारित केलक जाहि मे लिप्युलेख, कलापानी आ लिम्पियाधुरा के इलाका पर दावा कयल गेल छल, जे बहुत दिन सं भारत के नियंत्रण मे अछि.ई भारतीय पक्ष के धरचुला आरू लिप्यूलेख क॑ जोड़ै वाला सामरिक सड़क खोलै के जवाब म॑ छेलै ।ई मुद्दा द्विपक्षीय संबंधऽ के ऊपर अन्हार बादल के तरह टिकल रहलै जब॑ तलक कि दूनू पक्ष स्थापित तंत्र के माध्यम स॑ सीमा के मुद्दा क॑ संबोधित करै प॑ सहमत नै होय गेलै ।भारतीय पक्ष न॑ ई भी स्पष्ट करलकै कि नेपाल केरऽ “दायदायी केरऽ कृत्रिम विस्तार” ऐतिहासिक तथ्य प॑ आधारित नै छै आरू वार्ता के माध्यम स॑ उत्कृष्ट सीमा मुद्दा क॑ संबोधित करै लेली मौजूदा समझ के उल्लंघन करलकै ।कलापानी आरू सुस्ता केरऽ दू खिंचाव के विवाद के अलावा भारत-नेपाल केरऽ बाकी सीमा के निपटारा होय गेलऽ छै ।ई सीमा विवादऽ के बारे म॑ दूनू सरकारऽ के बीच मौजूदा तंत्र के माध्यम स॑ आरू सार्वजनिक चमक स॑ दूर करलऽ जाय के चाही, जेकरा स॑ विवादित मुद्दा क॑ देलऽ जाय आरू ले के भावना म॑ सॉर्ट करलऽ जाय सक॑ ।दुर्भाग्यवश ओ दिशा नहि जे काठमाण्डू हिलैत देखाइत अछि ।

title: JSP Nepal quits government - The Himalayan Times
description: JSP Nepal quits government  The Himalayan Times
publisher.title: The Himalayan Times
full_article:
KATHMANDU, MAY 13

The Janata Samajbadi Party (JSP) Nepal has withdrawn its support from the government.

Related Articles Ukraine says Russia is trying to break through its defenses in the northeastern Kharkiv region Meeting of JSP Nepal's central work execution committee commences

In a letter addressed to Speaker Devraj Ghimire today, JSP Nepal Chair Upendra Yadav stated that the party is withdrawing its support from the current government led by Prime Minister Pushpa Kamal Dahal.

Yadav further expressed that the party has resigned from the present government and will assume a constructive role as the opposition in the parliament."
translated: काठमांडू, 13 मई जनता समाजबादी पार्टी (जेएसपी) नेपाल अपन समर्थन सरकार स वापस ल लेलक अछि।संबंधित लेख यूक्रेन न॑ कहलकै कि रूस न॑ जेएसपी नेपाल केरऽ केंद्रीय कार्य निष्पादन समिति केरऽ उत्तर-पूर्वी खार्किव क्षेत्र केरऽ बैठक म॑ अपनऽ रक्षा क॑ तोड़ै के कोशिश करी रहलऽ छै, जेकरा म॑ वक्ता देवराज घिमिरे क॑ संबोधित करलऽ गेलऽ एगो पत्र म॑ शुरू करलऽ गेलऽ छै, जेएसपी नेपाल केरऽ अध्यक्ष उपेन्द्र यादव न॑ कहलकै कि पार्टी स॑ अपनऽ समर्थन वापस ल॑ रहलऽ छै । प्रधानमंत्री पुष्पा कमल दहल के नेतृत्व मे वर्तमान सरकार।यादव न॑ आगू व्यक्त करलकै कि पार्टी न॑ वर्तमान सरकार स॑ इस्तीफा द॑ देल॑ छै आरू संसद म॑ विरोध के रूप म॑ रचनात्मक भूमिका निभाबै छै ।

title: Chinese national suspected of spying arrested at Indo-Nepal border - MyIndMakers
description: Chinese national suspected of spying arrested at Indo-Nepal border  MyIndMakers
publisher.title: MyIndMakers
full_article:
A Chinese national was apprehended at the Siddharthnagar outpost along the Indo-Nepal border for unlawfully entering Uttar Pradesh, sparking suspicions of espionage.

On May 10, the Siddharthnagar police detained You Fenghao for illegally entering the state. A forensic analysis of his mobile phone has unveiled possible links to espionage activities.

A senior officer revealed that information extracted from the suspect's mobile phone suggested his connection to the Chinese army. Additionally, it unveiled photographs of Indian army units and indications of his travels to countries viewed as adversaries of India.

Prachi Singh, the superintendent of police in Siddharthnagar, informed TOI that initial interrogation and evidence suggest You Fenghao's involvement in espionage. She further stated that they have notified the Intelligence Bureau and senior officials of the UP police about this development.

Another officer involved in the investigation highlighted that You Fenghao's visits to several enemy countries, including Pakistan, and his photography of Indian Army installations, which were later deleted, raised suspicion. Additionally, the suspect's lack of cooperation during questioning added to the authorities' suspicions.

The police are currently examining You Fenghao's mobile phone and analysing call details to determine if he had contacts in India. Furthermore, his bank accounts are under scrutiny for any potential 'hawala links.'

On May 10, police and SSB personnel at the Harivanshpur border outpost (BOP), Liladihwa, received specific information about a person cycling toward the Indian side and conversing in a foreign language.

Upon arrival, the teams requested the cyclist to present his credentials. He identified himself as being from China and claimed to be using mobile translation. He stated that he had been in Nepal for three days and had entered India for sightseeing.

However, he failed to provide his credentials. Upon searching his possession, the authorities recovered Chinese Yuan and US dollars.

Image source: TOI
translated: भारत-नेपाल सीमा के साथ सिद्धार्थनगर चौकी पर एक चीनी नागरिक क॑ गैरकानूनी तरीका स॑ उत्तर प्रदेश म॑ प्रवेश करै के कारण गिरफ्तार करलऽ गेलै, जेकरा स॑ जासूसी के शंका पैदा होय गेलै ।10 मई कए सिद्धार्थनगर पुलिस अहां कए गैरकानूनी तरीका स राज्य मे प्रवेश करबाक लेल फेंगहाओ कए हिरासत मे लेलक।हुनकऽ मोबाइल फोन केरऽ फोरेंसिक विश्लेषण म॑ जासूसी गतिविधियऽ के संभावित लिंक के अनावरण करलऽ गेलऽ छै ।एक वरिष्ठ अधिकारी न॑ खुलासा करलकै कि संदिग्ध केरऽ मोबाइल फोन स॑ निकाललऽ गेलऽ जानकारी स॑ चीनी सेना स॑ हुनकऽ संबंध के सुझाव देलऽ गेलऽ छेलै ।एकरऽ अतिरिक्त, ई भारतीय सेना केरऽ इकाइयऽ के फोटो आरू भारत केरऽ विरोधी के रूप म॑ देखलऽ जाय वाला देशऽ के यात्रा के संकेत के अनावरण करलकै ।सिद्धार्थनगर केरऽ पुलिस केरऽ अधीक्षक प्राची सिंह न॑ टीओआई क॑ सूचित करलकै कि प्रारंभिक पूछताछ आरू सबूतऽ स॑ पता चलै छै कि आपने क॑ जासूसी म॑ फेंगहाओ केरऽ भागीदारी छै ।ओ आगू कहलनि जे ओ सब एहि विकास के बारे मे खुफिया ब्यूरो आओर यूपी पुलिस के वरिष्ठ अधिकारी के सूचित केने छथिन्ह.जांच म॑ शामिल एगो आरू अधिकारी न॑ ई बात प॑ प्रकाश डाललकै कि पाकिस्तान सहित कईएक दुश्मन देशऽ के दौरा आरू भारतीय सेना केरऽ इंस्टालेशन केरऽ हुनकऽ फोटोग्राफी, जेकरा बाद म॑ हटाय देलऽ गेलै, शंका उठैलऽ गेलै ।एकरऽ अतिरिक्त, पूछताछ के दौरान संदिग्ध केरऽ सहयोग के कमी स॑ अधिकारियऽ के शंका म॑ वृद्धि होय गेलै ।पुलिस एखन अहां के फेंगहाओ के मोबाइल फोन के जांच क रहल अछि आओर कॉल के विवरण के विश्लेषण क रहल अछि जे भारत मे हुनकर संपर्क अछि कि नहिं.संगहि, हुनकर बैंक खाता मे कोनो संभावित ‘हवाला लिंक’ के जांच मे अछि.10 मई क॑ हरिवानशपुर सीमा चौकी (बीओपी) केरऽ पुलिस आरू एसएसबी केरऽ जवानऽ क॑ भारतीय पक्ष के तरफ साइकिल चलाबै आरू विदेशी भाषा म॑ बातचीत करतें हुअ॑ एक व्यक्ति के बारे म॑ विशिष्ट जानकारी मिललै ।पहुंचला पर टीम सब साइकिल सवार स आग्रह केलक जे ओ अपन साख प्रस्तुत करथि।ओ अपन पहचान चीन के छल आ मोबाइल अनुवाद के उपयोग करय के दावा केलक.ओ कहलनि जे ओ तीन दिनक नेपाल मे छथि आ दर्शनीय स्थल पर भारत मे प्रवेश केने छलाह |मुदा, ओ अपन साख देबय मे असफल रहलाह.हुनकऽ कब्जा के खोज करला प॑ अधिकारियऽ न॑ चीनी युआन आरू अमेरिकी डॉलर के बरामदगी करलकै ।छवि स्रोत: TOI

title: 'From Nepal with Love:' Local International Grocery Store and Cafe Offers Frozen, Take-Home Cuisine - WKTV
description: 'From Nepal with Love:' Local International Grocery Store and Cafe Offers Frozen, Take-Home Cuisine  WKTV
publisher.title: WKTV
full_article:
Photo by Zach Lewis

UTICA, N.Y. -- An international grocery store and cafe located on the border of New York Mills and Utica has exciting news to share.

Muju International Groceries and Cafe recently garnered recognition from Mohawk Valley EDGE during Small Business Week for a segment of their business model—the Chula app.

Ujj Rai, a business and policy student from Harvard University, recently revitalized the Chula app, which stood as a semifinalist in the Social Impact category of the Harvard President's Innovation Challenge at the Harvard Innovation Labs.

From Nepal to Utica to Harvard: Local Business Owner Launches App Focused on Connecting the Community An app created by a Utica man has just launched.

Supported by EDGE and Oneida County, the Chula app secured a $10,000 grant last year to enhance its development.

Photo by Zach Lewis

As the app progresses, Muju International Groceries and Cafe has another update to share.

Situated at 1026 Champlin Ave., Muju has expanded Hut Number 22, offering homemade frozen Nepali delicacies to take home.

Hut Number 22 was also created to sell various spices.

This endeavor, led by Grace Rai, a Nepali refugee, showcases handcrafted delicacies crafted by a mother-daughter duo.

Photo by Zach Lewis

The Rais, who sought a fresh beginning in Utica, are committed to giving back to the community that welcomed them.

Ujj, an asylum-seeker from Nepal, crossed paths with Grace in 2017. Grace had already established herself in Utica, having received local education.

Photo by Zach Lewis

The couple tied the knot in 2018 and later established a thriving international grocery store in the Utica-New York Mills region, which just celebrated two years in business.

A Tale of 2 Years: Muju International Groceries and Cafe Continues to Cultivate Community A grocery store in Utica is celebrating another year in business.

One of Muju's most popular offerings, traditional Nepali steamed dumplings known as momos, can now be enjoyed in the comfort of your home—anytime you want.

Muju offers frozen momos in chicken, pork, and vegan versions, prepared authentically by Grace and her mother, Tula Rai, using locally sourced ingredients.

Photo by Zach Lewis

Grace said that although momos are visually akin to dumplings, momos boast a distinct Nepali flavor, prepared in the traditional way.

"I grew up eating Nepali culture food, and it became part of me," Grace explained on the Muju website.

"My own food carries a lot of warm feeling, memories, and always makes me feel home in a special and personal way. I truly believe food of our culture is our cultural identity and pride," she said.

Packed conveniently in sets of 20, these handcrafted momos can be steamed for approximately 15 minutes, seasoned to preference, and served.

Hut Number 22 "seeks to empower grandmothers with income, entrepreneurship, cultural preservation, independence, and community engagement opportunities."

Photo by Zach Lewis

This initiative not only offers employment prospects for newcomers like Rai's mother, but it also supports the local farming community, Grace said.

Frozen momos will be available for purchase starting May 14 at Muju International Groceries and Cafe.

For further information on the establishment making waves, click here.

Photo by Zach Lewis
translated: फोटो जैक लुईस यूटिका, एनवाई द्वारा -- न्यूयॉर्क मिल्स के सीमा पर स्थित एक अंतर्राष्ट्रीय किराना स्टोर आ कैफे आ यूटिका के पास साझा करय के लेल रोमांचक खबर अछि.मुजू इंटरनेशनल किराना आरू कैफे न॑ हाल ही म॑ अपनऽ बिजनेस मॉडल केरऽ एक खंड-----चुला ऐप के लेलऽ लघु व्यवसायिक सप्ताह के दौरान मोहॉक वैली एज स॑ मान्यता प्राप्त करलकै ।हार्वर्ड विश्वविद्यालय केरऽ एगो व्यवसाय आरू नीति के छात्र यूजेजे राय न॑ हाल ही म॑ चुला ऐप क॑ पुनर्जीवित करलकै, जे हार्वर्ड इनोवेशन लैब्स म॑ हार्वर्ड केरऽ अध्यक्ष केरऽ इनोवेशन चैलेंज केरऽ सामाजिक प्रभाव श्रेणी म॑ सेमीफाइनलिस्ट के रूप म॑ खड़ा छेलै ।नेपाल स॑ ल॑ क॑ यूटिका स॑ ल॑ क॑ हार्वर्ड तलक: स्थानीय व्यवसाय मालिक समुदाय क॑ जोड़ै प॑ केंद्रित ऐप न॑ यूटिका केरऽ एगो आदमी द्वारा बनावलऽ गेलऽ एगो ऐप न॑ अभी लॉन्च करलकै ।एज आरू ओनेडा काउंटी के समर्थन स॑ चुला ऐप न॑ पिछला साल अपनऽ विकास बढ़ाबै लेली १०,००० डॉलर के अनुदान प्राप्त करलकै ।फोटो के रूप में जैक लुईस के फोटो, मुजू इंटरनेशनल किराना आ कैफे के पास एकटा आओर अपडेट शेयर करय लेल अछि.1026 शैम्पलिन एवेन्यू पर स्थित मुजू न॑ झोपड़ी के नंबर 22 के विस्तार करलकै, जेकरा स॑ घरऽ लेली घरऽ के जमलऽ नेपाली स्वादिष्टता के प्रस्ताव देलऽ गेलऽ छै ।विभिन्न मसाला बेचबा लेल हट नंबर 22 सेहो बनल छल।नेपाली शरणार्थी ग्रेस राय के नेतृत्व में ई प्रयास में माँ-बेटी के जोड़ी द्वारा निर्मित हस्तनिर्मित स्वादिष्टता के प्रदर्शन करलऽ गेलऽ छै ।फोटो जैक लुईस केरऽ यूटिका म॑ एगो ताजा शुरुआत के खोज करै वाला रैस न॑ हुनकऽ स्वागत करै वाला समुदाय क॑ वापस दै लेली प्रतिबद्ध छै ।नेपाल केरऽ एगो शरणार्थी यूजेजे न॑ २०१७ म॑ ग्रेस के साथ मार्ग पार करी क॑ यूटिका म॑ खुद क॑ स्थापित करी चुकलऽ छेलै, जेकरा म॑ स्थानीय शिक्षा मिललऽ छेलै ।फोटो ज़ैच लुईस केरऽ दंपति न॑ २०१८ म॑ गाँठ बांधी क॑ यूटिका-न्यूयॉर्क मिल्स क्षेत्र म॑ एगो पोषण अंतर्राष्ट्रीय किराना स्टोर के स्थापना करलकै, जेकरा म॑ अभी-अभी दू साल के कारोबार मनाबै के मौका मिललै ।2 साल केरऽ एगो कहानी : मुजू इंटरनेशनल किराना आरू कैफे केरऽ खेती जारी छै, यूटिका म॑ एगो किराना दुकान व्यवसाय म॑ एक साल आरू मनाबै छै ।मुजू केरऽ एगो सबसें लोकप्रिय प्रसाद, पारंपरिक नेपाली भाप में पकौड़ी जेकरा मोमो के नाम सें जानलऽ जाय छै, के अब॑ आपने के घर केरऽ आराम में आनंद लेलऽ जाब॑ सकै छै-जखन-जखन आपने चाहै छियै ।मुजू चिकन, पोर्क, आरू शाकाहारी संस्करण म॑ जमे हुए मोमोस उपलब्ध करै छै, जेकरा ग्रेस आरू ओकरऽ मां, तुला राय द्वारा प्रामाणिक रूप स॑ तैयार करलऽ गेलऽ छै, जेकरा म॑ स्थानीय स्रोत स॑ प्राप्त सामग्री के उपयोग करलऽ गेलऽ छै ।जैक लुईस ग्रेस केरऽ फोटो न॑ कहलकै कि यद्यपि मोमो पकौड़ी स॑ दृश्य स॑ मिलै छै, लेकिन मोमोस एगो अलग नेपाली स्वाद के घमंड करै छै, जेकरा पारंपरिक तरीका स॑ तैयार करलऽ गेलऽ छै ।एमयूजीयू केरऽ वेबसाइट प॑ ग्रेस न॑ बतैलकै कि हम्में नेपाली कल्चर फूड खाय क॑ पललऽ-बढ़लऽ छेलियै, आरू ई हमरऽ हिस्सा बनी गेलै ।हुनी कहलकै, "हमरौ अपनौ भोजन बहुत गर्मजोशी स॑ महसूस करै छै, याद, आरू हमेशा हमरा खास आरू व्यक्तिगत तरीका स॑ घरऽ के महसूस करै छै। हम्में सही मायने म॑ ई मान॑ छियै कि हमरऽ संस्कृति के भोजन हमरऽ सांस्कृतिक पहचान आरू गर्व छै।"20 कें सेट मे सुविधाजनक रूप सं पैक कैल गेलय, इ हस्तनिर्मित मोमो कें लगभग 15 मिनट कें लेल भाप देल जा सकय छै, वरीयता कें लेल अनुभव कैल जा सकय छै, आ परोसल जा सकय छै.झोपड़ी नंबर 22 "आय, उद्यमिता, सांस्कृतिक संरक्षण, स्वतंत्रता, आ सामुदायिक संलग्नता के अवसर के साथ दादी के सशक्त बनाबै के कोशिश करै छै."ग्रेस न॑ कहलकै कि ज़ैच लुईस केरऽ फोटो ई पहल न॑ न सिर्फ राय केरऽ मां जैसनऽ नवागंतुकऽ लेली रोजगार के संभावना प्रदान करै छै, बल्कि ई स्थानीय खेती समुदाय क॑ भी समर्थन दै छै ।मुजू इंटरनेशनल किराना आ कैफे मे 14 मई स शुरू भ कए खरीदबा लेल जमल मोमोस उपलब्ध रहत।प्रतिष्ठान बनाबय के लहर के बारे में अधिक जानकारी के लेल, एतय क्लिक करू.फोटो ज़ैच लुईस द्वारा
